title: Zeffix 100MG Tab 2x7 (L)
details: This drug is used with other HIV medications to help control HIV infection.
precautions: Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history of Pancreatitis, Kidney problems, Liver problems such as hepatitis B or C, Cirrhosis, Alcohol use. Tell your doctor if you are pregnant before using this medication. Treatment can lower the risk of passing HIV infection to your baby.
effects: This drug may cause Headache, dizziness, nausea, diarrhea, or trouble sleeping, neutropenia, anemia, thrombocytopenia (changes in blood).

title: Sofiget+Ribazole 400/400MG Tab 1x28 (P)
details: it is used to treat Viral Infection and Hepatitis.
precautions: Use with caution having kidney disease, other liver problems (such as hepatitis B), Diabetes.

title: Tenofomide Tab 1x1 (P)
details: This medicine contains "tenofovir alafenamide" which is used for the treatment of hepatitis b virus in patients with compensated liver disease.
precautions: Keep it out of the reach of children. Store it below the room temperature i.e. below 25 degrees Celsius. Consult a doctor if youâ€™re hypersensitive to any of its ingredients. Do not take overdose, always take it in a recommended dose.
effects: No side effects are reported. Consult a doctor if it causes digestive problems i.e. gas, bloating, abdominal pain, GERD (gastroesophageal reflux disease), vomiting, nausea, or diarrhea, etc. Allergic reactions may occur i.e. skin itching, rashes, irritations, redness, & inflammation/swelling, etc. Other effects are drowsiness, dizziness, sleepiness, headache, etc.

title: Sofohil+Clavir+Novia 400/60/400MG Tab 1x28 (P)
details: it is used to treat Viral Infection and Hepatitis.
precautions: Use with caution having kidney disease, other liver problems (such as hepatitis B), Diabetes.

title: Daclaget 60MG Tab 4x7 (P)
details: It is used with another antiviral medication (sofosbuvir) to treat chronic (long-lasting) hepatitis C, a viral infection of the liver.
precautions: Use with caution having Kidney disease, Other liver problems (such as Hepatitis B), Diabetes. Strong CYP3A inducers are contraindicated with daclatasvir

title: Tenofo B 300MG Tab 1x30 (L)
details: It is used to treat chronic hepatitis B infection, a viral infection of the liver.
precautions: Use with caution having kidney problems, HIV infection, liver problems, Oteoporosis, Broken bones, Pancreatitis.

title: Centaurus 0.5MG Tab 3x10 (L)
details: It is used to treat chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) in adults and children who are at least 2 years old and weigh at least 22 pounds (10 kilograms).
precautions: Before taking entecavir, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of HIV infection, kidney disease, other hepatitis B drugs taken in the past. It is unknown if this drug passes into breast milk. Breast-feeding is not recommended while using this drug if you also have HIV. Otherwise, consult your doctor before breast-feeding. To decrease your risk of spreading hepatitis B to others, always use an effective barrier method (latex or polyurethane condoms/dental dams) during all sexual activity. Consult your doctor or pharmacist for more details.
effects: It can cause headache, dizziness, nausea, diarrhea, fatigue etc.

title: Eteva 0.5MG Tab 3x10 (L)
details: It is used to treat chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) in adults and children who are at least 2 years old and weigh at least 22 pounds (10 kilograms).
precautions: Before taking entecavir, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of HIV infection, kidney disease, other hepatitis B drugs taken in the past. It is unknown if this drug passes into breast milk. Breast-feeding is not recommended while using this drug if you also have HIV. Otherwise, consult your doctor before breast-feeding. To decrease your risk of spreading hepatitis B to others, always use an effective barrier method (latex or polyurethane condoms/dental dams) during all sexual activity. Consult your doctor or pharmacist for more details.
effects: It can cause headache, dizziness, nausea, diarrhea, fatigue etc.

title: Ocvir V 400/100MG Tab 1x1 (P)
details: it is used to treat Viral Infection and Hepatitis.
precautions: Use with caution having kidney disease, other liver problems (such as hepatitis B), Diabetes.
